phil desert rigour lawes giue iust cause feare many side haue felt theo frindes neuer felt least part others neither haue cause complaine much ease phil haue spoyled good cast prison among theeues complaine crueltie hanged traitours call ease could feele worse could theo meane northren rebel irish conspiratours thus hardly dealt phi though knew meant head quarter pitched rowes gate bridge day witness constancie momiments cruelty theo though gesse ean tell meane belike iesuits lately suffered treason phi treason obiected colour make odious people deede religion cause condemned would haue recanted faith neuer haue bene brought barre theo may pardon offered would recant trayterous assertion pope pleasure may depose prince discharge subiects obedience christian mildnes seeking amendment shall inflict cause church christ alwayes reioyced blood martyr patiently suffering cruell rage pagan arrians neuer fauoured tumult rebelles assembling themselues withstande authoritie phi tell v rather beseeme boyes schoole diuines church vaunting vertue learning ofte communicating much praying continuall meditation holy thinges fitte pharisee vnfit christian better sententiarum ex august decerptarum sayth austen humble confession euill proud vaunt well phi speake truth vaunt theo speake trueth commendation selues greatest pride shewe prouer let man prayse thee sayth salomon thine owne mouth iust reward error take notable paynes please selues inward perswasion owne worthines reuerenced others ye deepenes learning holines liues desire glorie possesseth head yt heraults fayle sticke rebell traitor queene realme traiterously sought practised irritate prince potentate hostility inuocating vpo soul neither knew saw heard aboad court rome writing mentioned proclamation iuly containing certaine article confederation pope king spaine prince inuasion realme theo heare sweare meane plainly phi doubt theo teach others inter quaestiones ad tribunal indicis pertinentes quaest quomodo respondendum tribunali haereticorum whe called count heretiks sophistice iurare sophistice respodere sophistically swear sophistically answere mocke magistrate captious cunning oth answere therefore vnlesse giue v preciser strickter oth trust traiterously seeke practise irritate prince potentate hostilitie queene realme needed addition sought traiterously meaning may bee sought lawfully faction would could doe must bee god men doe phi wee knowe woulde theo leaue follie search secretes men heartes accompt deedes matter impossible vehement impudent phi apolog chap sect verily may bee bishop bishop rome alone haue written v iust might haue determined bishop meane church thus vsed see ayding helping athanasius bishop rome neither worde deed take vpon vicar generall christ earth supreme iudge men matter church nowe doeth claymeth rather societie east bishop rest prouince hauing lesse interest church phi socrat lib cap idem lib cap say prerogatiue romane see ecclesiastical canon forbiddeth meddle church without consent romane bishop theo bishop rome prerogatiue first written vnto reason place first epist iulij alone written vnto saith iulius cur igitur primis de citie alexandria ignorant custome shoulde write v first reason place first rest hence iust might bee determined phi better text rome must bee determined right regiment church theo wise catch promise heare iulius euen speake wordes euery bishoppe vt ab omnibus quod iustum esset decerneretur euery one might determine iust iulius greater authoritie rest right bee determined phi canon church made euery thing voyde done without bishop rome sozomen lib cap theo call canon deed order taken bishop among theselues better guiding ye church common consent yet christian magistrate afterward liked allowed godly prince weightie matter consent al patriarks required best way keepe church peace quarrel faction waightie matter prouinciall councell might deale without consulting rest patriarkes decerneretur haue written v al iust might haue beene concluded canon haue written al first bishop rome reason place ye first order among patriarkes prerogatiue iulius epistle claymeth himselfe see prouinciall synode might attempt without rest deposition athanasius matter great weight theo yes deposing patriarke selfe matter great weight required consent rest appeareth councell antioch long paulus samosatenus shall finde cause condemnation layde downe large letter written prouinces namely dionysius maximus bishop rome alexandria euseb lib cap yet wrong offered athanasius time touched fayth church christ nearer one man iniurie phi theo arians shift practises almost gotten part east church finding two principall archbishop constantinople alexandria greatly hinder enterprise prouinces wide many stoutly defended trueth shielded thought best inuade one time thrusting paulus bishopricke plaine force pretending canon owne making athanasius west bishop quietly suffered without enterposing selues assisting brother two part worlde silence beene drowned arianisme themselues great danger long remaine without infection respect made earnest athanasius sozomene noteth sozome lib cap bishop throughout east fauoured nicene faith deposed cheefest seates inuaded arrians alexandria egypt arrians sought deposing posse east church antioche syria royal citie constantinople hellespont christ peter super illam petram hiero stand fitter referred christ peter soberly view christ name going first peter second sentence rule grammer super illam petram vpon rocke serueth aptly christ peter againe vehemencie verbe scio right sure doth argue wordes fitly referred christ peter church built christ christian euer doubted peter rocke church built austen others plainly denie phi hierom third epistle saith expresly petrus super quem dominus fundauit ecclesiam peter whome lorde built church hieron ad marcellum aduersus montanum tomo epi vpon rocke diuersly expounded father aug de verbis domini secundum mat serm church built none christ hilar de trin lib ibidem lib theo wordes sauiour gospell vpon rocke build church diuerse men haue diuersly taken austen expoundeth thus tu e ergo inquit petrus super hanc petram quam confessus e super hanc petram quam cognouisti dicens tu e filius dei viui edificabo ecclesiam meam id est super meipsum filium dei vini edificabo ecclesiam meam super edificabo te non super te thou art peter saith christ vppon rocke thou hast confessed vppon rocke thou hast acknowledged saying thou art christ sonne liuing god build church vpon selfe sonne liuing god build church builde thee vpon mee selfe thee hilarie likewise vnum est immobile fundamentum vna haec est faelix fidei petra petriore confessa tu e filius dei viui super hanc igitur confessionis petram ecclesiae edificatio est haec fides ecclesiae fundamentum est immoueable foundation onely happie rocke faith confessed peter mouth thou art sonne liuing god vpon rocke confession standeth building church faith foundation church doth ambrose ambros cap epist ad ephesio idem de incarnat dominici sacrament cap dominus dicit ad petrum super istam petram edificabo ecclesiam meam hoc est hac catholicae fidei confessione eides ergo est ecclesiae fundamentum non enim de carne petri sed de fide dictum est quia portae mortis ei non praeualebunt sed confessio vicit infernum lord saith peter vpon rocke builde church confession catholike faith faith therefore foundation church spoken peter flesh faith hell gate preuaile confession conquered hell chrysost homil matth bede cap iohannis vpon rocke builde church saith chrysostom vppon faith confession bede vppon rocke saith christ thou hast confessed build church rocke christ vpon foundation euen peter selfe builded meane paul doth right true foundatio church christ none else1 cor foundation man lay already laid iesus christ others knowe applie wordes vppon rocke builde church peter laide foundation church principal ber thereof origen mat tract peter mary hee alone laide foundation church rest apostle excluded spoken make common much elsewhere giuen origen onely vpon peter thou thinkest whole church built wilt thou say iohn euery apostle shall dare say peter onely gate hell shall preuaile rest apostle shall rather euerie one true saide gate hell shall preuaile also vpon rocke build church speech thee giue keyes kingdom heauen common goeth followeth spoken peter common hierom himselfe whose authoritie pretend hieron lib aduersus uiniaman placeth peter foundation church doth rest apostle likewise thou wilt say church built peter notwithstanding selfe another place done vpon apostle receiue keyes kingdom heauen stedfastnesse church equally setled vpon sense doth somewhat agree place paul ephes saith ye bee built vpon foundation peter alone apostle prophet iesus christ head corner stone respect paul saith iames peter iohn iointly seemed pillours galat gaue right handes fellowship construction admit neither construction make church rome tertul de praescription cyprian lib epi though prefer first religious cunning nearest true meaning sauiour wrest wordes hierom quite selfe rest learned catholike father one thing say church built peter orige hierom others affirme sense told thing say church built peter chaire rome father euer said thought therefore shoulde graunt hierom wordes spake councel basil began yeares doth confirme defend also repute heretikes egerly withstand word basiliensis concilij sessio councel basill pope veritas de potestate concilij generalis supra papam appeare whatsoeuer hath beene done attempted alleadged v name preiudice derogation sacred generall councell basill vndoe reuoke frustrate annihilate enough nicolaus came next eugenius vpon composing schisme betweene councell pope bull nicolaus like purpose bulla nicolai super approbatione actoru gest concil basiliensi gaue generall bull confirmation doinges without exception omnia singula tam iustitiam quam gratiam concernentia per ipsum tunc basiliense concilium qualitercunque facta gesta concessa data disposita ordinata cuiuscunque naturae existant motu proprio ex certa scientia de apostolicae potestatis plenitudine de consilio assensu venerabilium fratrum nostrorum sanctae romanae ecclesiae cardinaliu praesentium serie approbamus ratificamus etia confirmamus rata que firma cardinal holy church rome allow ratifie confirme tenor present haue stand sure firme councell basill hath ill lucke buls bee lawfull generall councell phi bishop rome came neuer liked ye councell basill striue shall see inferre theo newes pope mislike pared ambition hindered gaine councell basill denie yt councell orderly called phi stand much theo conclude councell might commaund correct depose pope obeied aboue councels councell may lawfully resist commaund correct depose pope late councels pisa constance basill church helde sacred ecumenicall determine wordes practise deedes must confute confesse illation phi haue saide coulde helpe councels proue generall see onely resisted deposed pope also concluded lawfull theo confesse might resist pope phi councels graunt might others theo may others like phi must rather obey resist theo dispute yet whether lawfull euery man resist pope cause iust commeth question must shewe good apparent reason may first auouched owne cardinales neuer call graunt peter successor importeth supremacie phi doth many thing proued starke false supremacie follow theo mary doth must first proue peter supreme gouernour church shall neuer next must since hierom wrate conclusio halteth though wordes goe right phi change must proue theo ala good sir begin doubt whether rome changed rome chainged mantuanus syluarum lib reade owne frier monkes abbot mathew paris monke albons euery toucheth ye vertues church rome saith known verie miscreant souldan iconium desired baptised rome math paris henrico sub anno noble reason many vice abounding rome sayd report romanes time bernardus de consideratione ad eugenium lib priuily behind back openly face forewarning eugenius pope looke hand quid tam notum seculis quam proteruia fastus romanorum gen insueta paci tumultui assueta gen immitis intractabilis vsque ad huc subdi nescia nisi cum non valet resistere experire paucis nouerim ne ego gentis more ante omnia sapientes sunt vt faciant mala bonum autem facere nesciunt impij deum temerarij sanctum seditiosi inuicem emuli vicinos inhumani extraneos hij sunt qui subesse non sustinet praeesse non norunt superioribus infideles inferioribus importabiles inuericundi ad petendum ad negandum frontosi importuni vt accipiant inquieti donec accipiant ingrati vbi acceperint docuerunt linguam suam grandia loqui cum operentur exigua largissimi promissores shall raigne highest degree celestiall euerlasting glorie priesthood washed vncleannesse life kingdome placeth preserueth men angel perfect eternall blisse speake respect v priesthood christ washeth hee haue none must seeke farther subiection tribunal land oweth non phi apol cap sect finally iurisdiction spirituall bee alwayes right sequele crowne scepter kinges assuredly christ none apostle call confirme preacher receiue bee sent god giue libertie preaching bishoppes may preach wihout cesars leaue submit themselues cesars sword apostle securitie person prince refuse doe god labourer must howe gather wordes christ apostle might preach gospell without cesars delegation licence others kinges country whither went see except take woord supreme superiour christ haue often signified vnto people theo hee neuer biteth barketh much make selfe sure thinges wee come triall vnsure proue either point affirme phi gospel prooueth first rhemish testament vpon luke prayed thee thy fayth fayle thou conuerted confirme thy brother say peter man hee woulde make superiour ouer whole church theo say belie word gospel iesuites would make collection confirme thy brother superiour ouer whole church phi none may confirme superiour theo one brother may confirme good syr may one brother comfort encourage phi yea peter must confirme brother theo confirming place recalling feare whe fled master leading example constant phi charge doe theo euery christian man like case lesse dauid defiling berseba murdering vriah promiseth peter appointed psal restore mee ioy thy saluation establish mee thy free spirit wil teach thy wayes vnto wicked sinner shal couerted vnto thee therefore inferre dauid supreme pastor ouer al wicked profound men christian duetie commo charitie prescribed peter respect fallen temptatio conclude singularitie superioritie ouer fellow disciple ouer whole church besides phi rhemish testament vpon luke christ praied peter erre shuld vtterly perish chrysost ioh homil idem mat homil learne thought fit prouidence god head church shuld haue special priuilege christ praier promise neuer fayle faith none either apostle bishop priest may chalenge singular speciall prerogatiue either office person otherwise ioyning peter holding theo learne abuse prouidence god promise sauiour serue wicked fansies christ promise peter iudgement shoulde neuer erre tentation nowe hande fayth shall vtterly fayle ego pro te oraui ne deficeret fides tua hoc est ne fine pereas haue prayed thee thy fayth shall fayle sayth chrysostome thou finally perish againe non dixit quippe non negabis sed vt non deficiat fides tua cura enim ipsius fauore factum est ne omnino petri fides euanesceret christ say thou shalt deny thy faith shall wholy fayle care fauour came passe peter faith vtterly bee extinguished bede beda cap luce sauiour praied peter hee shoulde tempted faith fayle fallen denying hee might rise againe repentance former state frame reason deede must marke illation howe absurd haue prayed thee thy fayth shall vtterly vanish though thou shalt thrise denie mee shamefully forsweare mee ergo neither peter neither successours erre matter religion aske boy bedlem would thus dispute phi peter denied faith person christ theo denieth person christ denieth part whole faith christ deny christ worse deceiued point saith sorer dangerous fal deny lord himselfe deceiued opinion faith euen confession peter thus placeth second epistle2 peter shalbe false teacher amongst shall priuily bring damnable sect yea denying lorde hath bought sauiour admonition seuen church asia reuelat sheweth hee denyeth name denyeth fayth thou holdest fast name sayth hee hast denyed fayth wherefore hold fast name christ deny fayth christ doubt since missing point fayth heresie denying christes name peter fell apostasie farre worse former see howe lewdly peruert word sauiour peter forewarned fall make woordes warrant hee shall fall lorde promised repentance turne text peter weree free offence phi hee offended fayth theo could deny christ denie faith hope christ bee greater infidelitie deny sonne god yet peter onely denyed thrise othe curse ratified deniall phi peter denied hee knewe theo hee knoweth christ fayth hope hath christ peter lost faith denied christ ambrose giuing cause peter speake weepe fall sayth ambros sermo petrus iam non vtitur sermone quo fefellerat quo peccauerat quo fidem amiserat peter nowe doeth vse speach hee lyed sinned hee lost fayth againe idem sermo fidelior factus est post quam fidem se perdidisse defleuit peter became hee sheweth ptolomie sunne contayneth bignes moone seuen thousande seuen hundred fourtie foure tymes many degree iumpe euery bishoppe aboue euery prince paringes offscouringes decretals haue swept iniuries done men brother thy brother sinne thee doe thee priuate wrong yet christian prince woordes sauiour charged disciple breake bonde peace vnitie brother offered wrong vntill first secretly de verbis domini sermo let thee ethnicke compt longer bee thy brother let thee ethnike publicane sayth augustine noli illum deputare iam numero fratrum tuorum nec ideo tamen salus eius negligenda accompt number thy brother yet saluation must bee neglected ethnikes themselues heathen men pagan wee doe recken bee brother yet seeke saue may doe well erect court euery subiect may sewe prince heathen prince bee depriued crownes scepter caesar heathen sauiour willed men giue caesar thinges caesar hee heathen magistrate whome christ stoode hee sayde thou couldest haue power ouer mee vnlesse giuen thee aboue heathen prince whome peter paul required charged christian prince bee subiect without resistance church christ taught doe submit selfe space three hundered yeeres heathen prince hath commaunded reason christias would resist taken confession wee pray emperours health asking able giue god forbid take thinges suffer euill part since wee desire suffer imagine reuenge wee waite meane bookes neither wee suppresse many chaunces bring eye knowe wee commaunded plentifull encrease charitie pray god enemy wish wel persecutours ibidem christian commanded god pray prince though persecutor ibidem yea namely plainely sayth pray king prince power thing may bee peaceable vnto empire bee shaken wee also must bee partaker fall woordes speake religion pietie christian towardes emperour whome wee must needes reuerence one lorde master hath chosen speake trueth caesar rather ordained god giuing better reason obeying warring saith hee men prince wee neighbour wish euill doe euill speake euill thinke euill indifferently forbidden v towardes men wee may man say may prince man much lesse highly aduanced god sounder seemelier doctrine christian bring v thomas aquinas v note margin see thomas saint making wee see paul peter saint past doubting see paul peter obedience heathen prince see continuall obedience christes church long pagan heathen prince sworde shee taught men christian shoulde loue reuerence honour heathen prince ordayned god beare swoorde euen god christian might neither wish euill doe euill speake euill thinke euill power much lesse resist armes depriue superioritie ouer christian new saint seemeth say lest thinke christian time serued honoured heathen prince rather feare conscience open slaunder lewde shift directly thwarting woordes saint paul rom must subiect wrath also conscience sake shall heare tertullian report place force christian thought lawfull godly resist cruelly vexed oppressed tertul apologetico one night saith fierbrands would yeeld v reuenge sufficient lawfull v requite euill euill god forbid either take part god shoulde reuenge themselues humane fier greeued suffer wherein tried would practise secrete reuenge professe open enmitie mark face christian yeres christ could lacke nuber men force armes moore think parthian one nation whatsoeuer mo nu ber wee spred ouer whole world yet haue filled al place roomes haue city ilands castle townes asseblies tent tribe wardes yea palace senate iudgement seates warre wee able readie though wee fewer number goe deathes gladly lawfull religion slaine slea could without armes neuer rebelling diuiding selues haue doone spite enough separation great multitude haue broken corner world losse many citizen woulde haue shamed punished beleeue would haue bin afraid see selues left alone amazed amongst dead see silence desolation euery woulde haue moe enemy desolation would haue followed christias haue forsaken pagan citizen almost christian inhabitauntes nowe haue fewer enemy reason multitude citizen almost christian within two hundreth yeeres christ beeleeuers heare tertullian wanted neither number strength courage resist reuenge persecutours number force foure fiue sixe hundreth yeeres christ backed prince defended lawes prouoked fauours honour professe religion yet neither vnder pagan arrians woulde resist armes yeelded liues submission though wanted neither meanes multitude conuenient warres phi howsoeuer bee defence cap plaine kinges haue professed fayth christ defence church gospell may bee haue beene iustly excommunicated deposed iniuries done childerike deposed hee placed kingdome regino lib anno regino whence fable first came stephen sicknesse paris recouerie vision sainct denis saieth worde absolution onely stephen confirmed pipine two sonnes lawfull kinges france iesuites must proue pope may dispence lawful oth staggering story make many men thinke childerike foole adiured noble choose king line long pipines race indured rest added monk frier fauor pope infinite thinges accidentes euerie age howbeit absoluing others lawfull good greater matter yet beleeue holy father may deale wauering story cause childerikes deposition sometimes vrge defect childerike sometimes pleade right pipine without king aboue king hauing regiment realme publike affaire committed space fourscore yeares way inheritaunce hee sought crowne causis primum videlicet quod ab eorum communione qui pro sacrilegio reatu simoniaca haeresis excommunicati sunt se abstiuere noluit deinde quod pro criminosis actibus paenitentiam non dico suscipere sed nec promittere voluit synodali iudicio eum excommunicauimus cause witte first would forbeare companie excommunicated sacrilegious hereticall guylt symonie next hee farre taking penance handes armes religion soueraigne therefore warres religion trayterous insurrection prince lawes edward third notwithstanding newe found glozes first depose resist pursue armes warrant holy church iudgement censure phi edward third neuer ment obey pope aboue prince bee treason edward neuer ment deposed pope therefore warre depose treaso theo appoint meaning woordes giue ayde comfort king enemy leuied warres realme pope french king ye shoulde bee treason hee eye example king iohn vpon whome pope set king france power obeying censure rome knew hee could bee defeated crowne without warre long owne doe may dispose people bee master parentes may dispose magistrate much lesse may turne lawes made punish subiectes themselues make prince ouer others subiectes vnder trust bee see disparison example disiuncture argument heresie dissolueth matrimonie cor yet supposementes bee simplie true neither infidelitie heresie god lawe doeth dissolue matrimonie apostle willeth beleeuing wife staie professe though prince realme haue doone nothing herein god man lawe doth warrant yet may wee suffer stande quirk delude god ueth tertul de virg velandis tertullian sayth man may prescribe space tymes etur ab omnibus quado lectio legitur facto siletio aeque audiatur ab omnibus ideo diaconus clara voce silentiu admonet vt siue du psallitur siue dum lectio pronunciatur ab omnibus vnitas coseruetur vt
